10 Ways to Reconnect With Yourself ðŸ˜˜

 

These days we have so many gadgets, apps., online conveniences, and so much more but still, it feels like we never have enough time for ourselves.

When I do have some free time, I find myself looking for something to do rather than connecting with myself.

When I was younger, I would do all kinds of soul searching and reading and, whatever felt good for my spirit. Â Now, I find that I Â rarely connect with myself anymore.

So, I started a list (on my smartphone of course) on the ways that I have started connecting with myself again.

The following is my list:

10 Ways to Reconnect With Yourself ðŸ˜˜

 

Do one of the following or more!!

 

Connecting with yourself

 

  1. Take fifteen minutes per day no matter what to reconnect.
  2. Sit next to a window and just stare and daydream.
  3. Take a walk. Â When is the last time that you took a walk by yourself?
  4. Get on the floor and stretch every part of your body.
  5. Meditate. Â It was hard for me to meditate because I am an anxious person by nature, however, using my smartphone, I downloaded an app. with meditation music. Â Â I close my eyes and try to stay in the moment. Â I go through a list of forgiveness and gratitude and before I know it, fifteen minutes is up, and I feel great! Â It takes a few times, but the music helps.
  6. Sit in a sauna or Jacuzzi and just relax. Â I use an infrared sauna, and I sit in it for thirty minutes per day. Â I swear it clears my mind.
  7. Okay, I’m about to go deep here ðŸ˜¬Â  Comfortably lay down or sit and think back as far as you can remember to when you were a child. Â Then, watch yourself grow up. Â Go through every year of your life until now. Â If you can do it, it’s amazing. Â If you’re like me and you have some forgiving yourself to do, it is very healing and closes a lot of doors.
  8. If you’re lucky enough to have a parent or both, spend time with them weekly. Â It’s one of the biggest connections with yourself that you’ll miss when they’re gone.
  9. Do something that you love. Â I love to cook and I really get into the groove. It relaxes me. Â Maybe you like to crochet or paint? Â Fifteen minutes a day will create some beautiful things in no time. Â Remember though, no agenda.
  10. Don’t wait until the kids are grown, the debt is paid off, you retire, or anything else. Â Do what you want now because today is a gift and tomorrow is not promised. Â I’m sure that I don’t have to remind you about how life goes so fast.

 

Notice that I didn’t say exercise on the list. Â I think that doing anything that has a goal defeats the purpose of connecting with yourself as there is an agenda.

The ten recommendations above are so that your mind and your soul can merge together without a whole lot of effort.

It’s like resting the mind so our soul feels regenerated.

That was my list. Â I would love to see yours. ðŸ˜€
